result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rachel L. Micoley

records.addlTxt: 1:28 PM Defendant Rachel L. Micoley in court, in custody.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Rachel L. Micoley. Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court makes stmt. State's Exhibit #1 - plea negotiations marked/received/reviewed by the Court. Victim rights. Defendant waives reading of count 1 in 22CF89 and enters a plea of NO CONTEST to the count. PLQ received/reviewed by the Court w/ the defendant. Balance of charges in 22CF89 and case 22CM38 dismissed/read-in. Court finds defendant's plea to be made freely and voluntarily. Factual basis found. Adjudge guilty. State's recommendation. Atty Hansen makes stmt. Defendant makes stmt. Court makes stmt. Court sentence on 22CF89 count 1; Imposed/stayed 9 months jail, 1 year DOC probation w/ conditions, no possession/consumption of alcohol, controlled substance without valid Rx and/or drug paraphernalia, continue mental health treatment w/ Oconto County DHS professional Pam Paige, take all medications as prescribed by Dr and take properly, Compas Exam and follow through w/ all recommendations, no contact w/ Brad Vickman unless for legal purposes, can go to property w/ law enforcement to obtain personal belongings, court costs of $263 and DNA surcharge of $200 payable to the COC office at the rate of $100/month commencing 7/10/2022, submit DNA sample. Default of payment debt referred to SDC. Supervision fees payable to DOC during probation.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:52 PM Defendant Rachel L. Micoley in court.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Rachel L. Micoley.  Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant ordered to appear at next hrg. NOH given to defendant in jail.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:27 PM Defendant Rachel L. Micoley in court.  Atty Hansen appears with deft.  Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin.
Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

W/condition Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact w/ S.D., B.V.  Defendant shall immediately report to the Sheriff's Department for fingerprinting and photographing. Defendant may return to residence one time with law enforcement to get personal belongings.  Not to reside at current residence.

1:28 PM Defendant Rachel L. Micoley in court, in custody.  Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin by phone.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, and advised of right to counsel/SPD.  Bond is set.  Notice of Hearing given to Deft. in Jail.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
